Tasks.Task Description: Use Azure Monitor and Application Insights to continuously track the performance metrics of Azure Cosmos DB, including throughput, latency, and request units (RUs). Investigate and resolve any anomalies.
Implement and regularly verify automated backups for Azure Cosmos DB. Test restore procedures to ensure data recovery in case of accidental deletion or corruption.
Periodically review and optimize indexing policies to ensure efficient query performance and cost management.
Conduct regular audits of security settings, including firewall rules, IP restrictions, and access keys. Rotate keys as per security policies.
Monitor usage patterns and adjust provisioned throughput or switch to autoscale mode to meet application demands while optimizing costs.
Perform failover tests to validate the resiliency of Azure Cosmos DB in case of regional outages. Ensure data replication and availability across configured regions.
Analyze query metrics and optimize queries to reduce RU consumption and improve response times.
Ensure that applications using Azure Cosmos DB are updated with the latest SDKs and libraries to leverage new features and security updates.
Evaluate the partition key strategy to ensure optimal data distribution and scalability. Adjust as necessary based on application requirements.
Verify that Azure Cosmos DB configurations comply with organizational and regulatory standards, such as GDPR or HIPAA.
Keep operational and configuration documentation for Azure Cosmos DB up-to-date, including procedures for troubleshooting and disaster recovery.
Conduct drills to prepare for potential incidents, such as data breaches or service outages. Ensure the team is familiar with response protocols.
Review cost metrics and usage patterns to identify opportunities for cost optimization, such as adjusting throughput or consolidating regions.
Ensure the operations team participates in training sessions to stay updated with new Azure Cosmos DB features and best practices.
